Buttons

The buttons at the top of the web page are the on/off switches for different kinds of named entities already marked up in the text file. Click on the buttons to show or hide personal or place names, reign periods or official titles. The colors of the buttons correspond with the colors of the font of the key terms. 
熙寧初，王荊公力薦.....。

Text Features

Single Underline appears when there is no match for a name (姓名、別名) in CBDB: 
奉職程若英乃文臣程博文之子，上書言....

Dotted underline appears when there is more than one match for a name (姓名、別名) in CBDB: 
數日後，臺諫王能甫.....

Square brackets appear when names overlap (example 1) and when a name could belong to more than one tag category (example 2): 
靖康末，趙子崧守陳州。子崧先在邸中剽竊此說，至是適天下大亂...
觀主道士張景先，出入黃安中之門甚久。

Icons in the context menu

= save changes
= search online (in a Chinese dictionary for untagged entities, otherwise in the respective database)
= search in document (requires more than one occurrence in the document)
= remove tag(s) (removes tag from selected entity; click "Search in document" to remove or edit multiple occurrences)


In search in document mode (),
= approve edit
= edit locked

Icons will show when you click a tagged term (姓名,別名,年號,地名,官職). Try it below: 
數日後，臺諫王能甫.....。車駕始至臨安府...
奉職程若英乃文臣程博文之子，上書言....

Other right menu buttons

= Edit
Click on the edit button to start inline text editing. After it has turned red, you can correct textual mistakes or add punctuation. All edits will be saved when you export or save the file. The text will be locked again after clicking the edit button a second time.

= Tag summary
Click on tag summary to view a summary of the number of tags added to the file by type. You can also extract and export all tags to a spreadsheet. The tag management function allows you to remove or deactivate individual tags.

= Markup selection (in Automated markup mode only)
Click on markup selection to view which tags have been marked so far. You can also add more categories for automated markup to the file currently in use.

= Go to passage
If the text has been dividided into passages, you can use this button to directly jump to a specific number.

= Add comment
Allows you to comment on individual passages of the text. (Logged-in users only)

= Manage tags
Change button names for tags, remove tags and corresponding buttons, and add new buttons. (Logged-in users only)

= Manage web references
Customize the dictionaries and databases available for looking up online. (Logged-in users only)
